title: Bug 269522 - Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice
description: In the cross reference view and markers, the joinpoints assigned to advice are getting mixed up. When selecting one piece of after advice, I see all of the joinpoints for both after advice statements. However, when I select the other after advice statement, I see no joinpoints. Additionally, when I select the marker for either piece of after advice, I see all the joinpoints for both pieces of advice.
OB:
1. Open the attached project and perform a clean compile.
2. Open the cross reference view.
3. Select line 22 and note that you see 5 joinpoints (should only be 3).
4. Select line 68 and note that you see zero joinpoints (should be 2 here).
5. Right-click the marker at line 68 and choose 'advises' - note that you see all 5 joinpoints.
6. Right-click the marker at line 22 and choose 'advises' - note that you see all 5 joinpoints.
SR:
1. Ensure the joinpoints assigned to advice are displayed correctly in the cross reference view and markers.
2. Verify that selecting one piece of after advice only shows the joinpoints for that specific advice statement.
3. Confirm that selecting the marker for a piece of advice only displays the joinpoints associated with that particular advice statement.
